comment.text: Activates the JUN N-terminal pathway. Required for serum-stimulated cell proliferation and for mitogen and cytokine activation of MAPK14 (p38), MAPK3 (ERK) and MAPK8 (JNK1) through phosphorylation and activation of MAP2K4/MKK4 and MAP2K7/MKK7. Plays a role in mitogen-stimulated phosphorylation and activation of BRAF, but does not phosphorylate BRAF directly. Influences microtubule organization during the cell cycle.
ATP + a protein = ADP + a phosphoprotein.
Homodimerization via the leucine zipper domains is required for autophosphorylation and subsequent activation.
Homodimer; undergoes dimerization during activation. Interacts with MAP2K4/MKK4. Interacts with MAP2K7/MKK7 (By similarity).
Expressed in a wide variety of normal and neoplastic tissues including fetal lung, liver, heart and kidney, and adult lung, liver, heart, kidney, placenta, skeletal muscle, pancreas and brain.

Autophosphorylation on serine and threonine residues within the activation loop plays a role in enzyme activation. Thr-277 is likely to be the main autophosphorylation site. Phosphorylation of Ser-555 and Ser-556 is induced by CDC42.
Belongs to the protein kinase superfamily. STE Ser/Thr protein kinase family. MAP kinase kinase kinase subfamily.

property.value: Signaling by moderate kinase activity BRAF mutants
Paradoxical activation of RAF signaling by kinase inactive BRAF
F:mitogen-activated protein kinase kinase kinase binding
P:positive regulation of JUN kinase activity
P:positive regulation of neuron apoptotic process

feature.description: Loss of kinase activity. Prevents activation of SAPK and MAPK14.
Severely reduced autophosphorylation activity. Prevents phosphorylation of SAPK and MAPK14.
No effect on autophosphorylation activity or activation of SAPK and MAPK14.
Reduced autophosphorylation activity. Reduced activation of SAPK and MAPK14.
